cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 455 mi ESE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn west-northwest on Sunday, then northwest Monday and north on Tuesday, passing well east of the Leeward Islands and the Virgin Islands before recurving into the open Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall expected; center forecast to remain east of the Leeward Islands and the Virgin Islands

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coasts of the northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, and Puerto Rico may experience hazardous surf and rip currents from distant Philippe.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely outcome is breezy conditions under 34 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; storm center remains far offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periodic squalls or showers possible Monday–Tuesday, but widespread totals likely below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along east-facing beaches beginning late weekend and persisting into early week.
